$schema: Agent team role definitions for /develop lifecycle
description: Role definitions for Claude Code agent teams used by the /develop skill

responsibilities: Break issue into parallelizable tasks with dependencies
Spawn and coordinate teammates
Review completed work against code-reviewer-config.json criteria
Run Phase 3 (Verification) checks as gate
Execute Phase 4 (Documentation) and Phase 5 (Completion)
Synthesize teammate results and resolve conflicts
Manage dev_communication messaging and issue updates
Implement source code following FSD patterns
Create TypeScript types in entity layer
Follow patterns from memory/ and applicable ADRs
Use existing abstractions and conventions
Create API hooks and integration code
implementer.spawnPrompt: You are an implementer teammate. Your task: {task_description}. Follow FSD architecture (entities > features > widgets > pages). Use existing patterns from memory/patterns/. Use shadcn/ui + Tailwind for UI components. Define types in the entity layer. Do NOT write tests - the tester teammate handles that. Ensure TypeScript compiles cleanly.

tester.spawnWhen: Issue requires new tests or has test acceptance criteria
responsibilities: Write unit tests using Vitest + React Testing Library
Write integration tests for complex flows
Ensure tests have meaningful assertions
Cover edge cases (empty states, errors, loading)
Create test mocks (minimal and focused)
tester.spawnPrompt: You are a tester teammate. Your task: {task_description}. Write tests using Vitest and React Testing Library. Tests must have meaningful assertions - not just 'renders without crashing'. Cover happy path, error states, loading states, and edge cases. Use MSW for API mocking. Follow testing patterns in memory/patterns/. Check existing test files nearby for conventions.

researcher.spawnWhen: Issue is complex and requires deep codebase understanding before implementation
responsibilities: Analyze existing code patterns relevant to the issue
Find similar implementations to use as reference
Identify affected files and potential impacts
Map FSD layer dependencies for the change
Report findings to lead for task planning
researcher.spawnPrompt: You are a researcher teammate. Investigate the codebase to support: {task_description}. Find existing patterns, similar implementations, affected files, and potential impacts. Check memory/patterns/ and memory/entities/ for documented conventions. Report your findings clearly with file paths and code references. Do NOT write or modify any code.

bugFix.description: Bug fix with regression test (TDD style)

coordinationRules.fileOwnership: Each teammate owns distinct files. No two teammates edit the same file.
coordinationRules.communicationPattern: Teammates report to lead via task updates. Lead broadcasts only for scope changes.
coordinationRules.conflictResolution: Lead resolves conflicts. If teammates disagree on approach, lead decides.
coordinationRules.modelOverride: Lead can specify different models per teammate if needed.
coordinationRules.shutdownOrder: Shut down all teammates before Phase 4 (Documentation). Lead handles Phases 4-5 solo.
